title: LIVE hosts Kelly Ripa and Ryan Seacrest dress up like cowboys and ride horses on NYC streets
text:
LIVE hosts Ryan Seacrest and Kelly Ripa dressed up like cowboys and rode horses down the streets of Manhattan on Friday for a pre-taped Halloween segment.

Each horse had a wire-thin reign connected to their bridles, which allowed the off-camera trainers to control their gate.

The Atlanta-born 44-year-old and the New Jersey-born 49-year-old appeared to have a blast getting out of the office to film in the bustling Big Apple.

Yee-haw! LIVE hosts Ryan Seacrest (L) and Kelly Ripa (R) dressed up like cowboys and rode horses down the streets of Manhattan on Friday for a pre-taped Halloween segment

Don't stray! Each horse had a wire-thin reign connected to their bridles, which allowed the off-camera trainers to control their gate

Kelly's costume included a cowboy hat, brown leather vest, and massive wide-leg pants - which completely hid her slim 5ft3in frame.

The six-time Daytime Emmy winner then danced a little jig for onlookers to better showcase her bizarre buttoned legwear.

Ripa made sure to kiss her steed on the brow after her wild ride.

Meanwhile, Ryan - whose pin-stripe pants were far more conservative - did his best Clint Eastwood in an ankle-length duster jacket, cowboy hat, vest, and bandanna.

The Emmy-winning producer then waved around his arms while curiously throwing up devil horn symbols with his hands.

The morning talk show takes Halloween very seriously and last year the pair tackled sitcom characters - Laverne & Shirley, I Love Lucy, I Dream of Jeannie, and CHiPs.

'Home Week': On Friday, the perky presenters welcomed Julie Andrews (L) promoting her memoir Home Work and Michelle Pfeiffer (R) promoting her movie Maleficent: Mistress of Evil

On Friday, the perky blonde presenters welcomed Michelle Pfeiffer promoting her movie Maleficent: Mistress of Evil, and Julie Andrews promoting her memoir Home Work.

LIVE with Kelly and Ryan - now in its 32nd season - are up for the best daytime talk show trophy at the 45th People's Choice Awards, which air November 10 on E!

The hosting duo face heavy competition against The View, Red Table Talk The Ellen DeGeneres Show, The Wendy Williams Show, Today, Good Morning America, and The Real.
